heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 15 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 5th since records began in 23 September 2024.  The current stretch started on 09 September 2025 and has lasted 9 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (194°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 612 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1098 m) and light levels (up 3441 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 612.1m lower than yesterday, 556.2m lower than the past week, 1097.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 850m and a peak of 2900m, averaging 934.6m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and periods of sunshine are expected. The weather will likely remain the same.
